summary: This is an email chain between FBI agents discussing a request to run license plate readers (LPRs) on vehicles associated with Jeffrey Epstein in Florida and New York to monitor his movement. The emails were sent in late June and early July 2019, shortly before Epstein's arrest.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The email chain discusses running license plate readers on vehicles associated with him to monitor movement in Florida and New York.

events.title: Request for LPR surveillance on Epstein's vehicles
events.description: An FBI agent requests that local police run license plate readers on vehicles associated with Jeffrey Epstein in Florida to monitor movement.

events.title: Confirmation of LPR hits in Florida
events.description: An FBI agent confirms there have been license plate reader hits on Epstein's vehicles all over south Florida, including the turnpike.

events.title: Follow-up on LPR surveillance
events.description: An FBI agent follows up to ask if there were any recent hits on the license plates of Epstein's vehicles.

keyFacts: FBI agents were actively surveilling Jeffrey Epstein's vehicle movements using license plate readers in Florida and New York in June-July 2019.

The surveillance targeted specific vehicles: a 2019 black Chevy Suburban (Florida plate KQUV02), a 2018 black Chevy Suburban (Florida plate FLIGK55), and a 2016 black Chevy Suburban (New York plate HCP5713).
There were confirmed LPR hits on Epstein's vehicles 'all over south Florida including the turnpike' as of June 27, 2019.
The email chain shows coordination between FBI agents in different locations regarding the Epstein investigation.
This surveillance activity occurred shortly before Epstein's arrest on July 6, 2019.
